ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A wide reaching exploration of the different ways of approaching an understanding of our current world and the roles that media play within it.
I would not recommend Mediascapes to another student, unless they were very interested in the topic and prepared for a potentially hit-or-miss seminar depending on class dynamics.
A really great course that will satisfy many interests, definitely worth taking. One of those rare classes where you get a lot of mileage out of a manageable workload.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course added more ways of thinking to my repertoire and contributed to my own research well.
Many of the readings are applicable to anyone thinking about space and media theoretically. I found, through the lens of the course, many new authors and resources that I could apply in my research.
It enhances my understanding of the relationship between media and space.

It has been a very useful class, which have to give me new perspectives on how to understand and conceptualize media. I find this new way of looking at our world inspiring and challenging at the same time, and it is definitely something I will take with me in my future studies.

This course served as both an introduction to media theory and a channel to a very specific branch of thinking for me. It definitely helped me in terms of research and establishing long term interests and areas of study.
